title: Basic Use
text: need install devtools already done : use devtools install michigancolors.

title: Basic Use
text: Colors drawn https://brand.umich.edu/design-resources/colors/. Allowable colors : “blue”, “maize”, “tappan red”, “ross school orange”, “wave field green”, “taubman teal”, “arboretum blue”, “ann arbor amethyst”, “matthaei violet”, “umma tan”, “burton tower beige”, “angell hall ash”, “law quad stone”

title: Basic Use
code: hist(iris$Petal.Length, col = michigancolors()) hist(iris$Petal.Length,       col = michigancolors(),      main = "Petal Length of Iris Flowers",      xlab = "Petal Length")

title: Basic Use
code: hist(iris$Petal.Length, col = michigancolors("matthaei violet")) plot(iris$Petal.Length,       iris$Sepal.Length,       pch = 19,      col = michigancolors("tappan red"))

title: Basic Use
code: ggplot(iris,         aes(x = Petal.Length,             fill = Species)) +    geom_density(alpha = .5) +    labs(title = "Density Plot of Species in Iris Data Set") +    theme_minimal() +    scale_fill_manual(values = michigancolors()) ggplot(iris,         aes(x = Petal.Length,             y = Sepal.Length,             color = Species)) +    geom_point() +    geom_smooth() +    labs(title = "Scatterplot of Iris Data Set") +    theme_minimal() +    scale_color_manual(values = michigancolors()) #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Basic Use
code: library(ggdist) # distribution plots  ggplot(iris,        aes(x = Species,            y = Petal.Length,            fill = Species)) +   geom_dots(dotsize = 3, # dot size             color = "black") + # outline color   labs(title = "Petal Length by Iris Species") +    theme_minimal() +    scale_fill_manual(values = c(michigancolors("arboretum blue"),                                michigancolors("ann arbor amethyst"),                                michigancolors("matthaei violet")))

title: Authors and Citation
text: Grogan-Kaylor (2024). michigancolors: Use University Michigan colors R graphs. R package version 1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {michigancolors: Use University of Michigan colors in R graphs},   author = {Andrew Grogan-Kaylor},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.0}, }

title: Use University of Michigan colors in R graphs
text: hist(iris$Petal.Length, col = michigancolors()) hist(x, col = michigancolors()) plot(x, y, col = michigancolors("blue")) ggplot(iris, aes(x = Petal.Length, y = Sepal.Length, color = Species)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth() + ggtitle("Scatterplot Iris Data Set") + theme_minimal() + scale_color_manual(values = michigancolors())

title: University of Michigan color palette — michigancolors
code: hist(iris$Petal.Width, col = michigancolors())  hist(iris$Petal.Length, col = michigancolors("blue"))  plot(iris$Petal.Length, iris$Petal.Width, col = michigancolors("arboretum blue"), pch = 19)
